item.text: When Solomon had finished constructing the Lord’s temple, he put the holy items that belonged to his father David (the silver, gold, and all the other articles) in the treasuries of God’s temple.

Then Solomon convened Israel’s elders—all the leaders of the Israelite tribes and families—in Jerusalem, so they could witness the transferal of the ark of the covenant of the Lord from the City of David (that is, Zion).

<st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> the <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="06950" class="">assembled</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">before</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> during the <st data-num="02282" class="">festival</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01931" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="07637" class="">seventh</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st>.<n id="2" />

When <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel’s</st> <st data-num="02205" class="">elders</st> had <st data-num="0935" class="">arrived</st>, the <st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st> <st data-num="05375" class="">lifted</st> the <st data-num="0727" class="">ark</st>.

The <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st> and <st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">carried</st> the <st data-num="0727" class="">ark</st>, the <st data-num="0168" class="">tent</st> where <st data-num="04150" class="">God appeared to his people</st>,<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="06944" class="">holy</st> <st data-num="03627 0834">items</st> in the <st data-num="0168 05927">tent</st>.<n id="2" />
Now King Solomon and all the Israelites who had assembled with him went on ahead of the ark and sacrificed more sheep and cattle than could be counted or numbered.
The priests brought the ark of the covenant of the Lord to its assigned place in the inner sanctuary of the temple, in the Most Holy Place under the wings of the cherubim.

The <st data-num="03742" class="">cherubim’s</st> <st data-num="03671" class="">wings</st> <st data-num="01961 06566">extended</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> the <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st> where the <st data-num="0727" class="">ark</st> sat; the <st data-num="03742" class="">cherubim</st> <st data-num="03680 05921 04605">overshadowed</st> the <st data-num="0727" class="">ark</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">and</st> its <st data-num="0905" class="">poles</st>.<n id="1" />

The <st data-num="0905" class="">poles</st> <st data-num="0748" class="">were</st> so <st data-num="0748" class="">long</st> <st data-num="0905" class="">their</st> <st data-num="07218" class="">ends</st> extending out <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="0727" class="">ark</st> were <st data-num="07200" class="">visible</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">in front of</st> the <st data-num="01687" class="">inner sanctuary</st>, but they could <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="07200" class="">seen</st> <st data-num="02351" class="">from beyond that point</st>.<n id="1" /> They have <st data-num="01961" class="">remained</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> very <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>.
There was nothing in the ark except the two tablets Moses had placed there in Horeb. (It was there that the Lord made a covenant with the Israelites after he brought them out of the land of Egypt.)
The priests left the Holy Place. All the priests who participated had consecrated themselves, no matter which division they represented.

<st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> the <st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st> who were <st data-num="07891" class="">musicians</st>, including <st data-num="0623" class="">Asaph</st>, <st data-num="01968" class="">Heman</st>, <st data-num="03038" class="">Jeduthun</st>, and their <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> and <st data-num="0251" class="">relatives</st>, <st data-num="03847" class="">wore</st> <st data-num="0948" class="">linen</st>. They played <st data-num="04700" class="">cymbals</st> and <st data-num="05035 03658">stringed instruments</st> as they <st data-num="05975" class="">stood</st> <st data-num="04217" class="">east</st> of the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>. They were <st data-num="05973" class="">accompanied</st> by <st data-num="03967 06242">120</st> <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st> who <st data-num="02690" class="">blew</st> <st data-num="02689" class="">trumpets</st>.

The trumpeters and musicians played together, praising and giving thanks to the Lord. Accompanied by trumpets, cymbals, and other instruments, they loudly praised the Lord, singing: “Certainly he is good; certainly his loyal love endures!” Then a cloud filled the Lord’s temple.
The priests could not carry out their duties because of the cloud; the Lord’s splendor filled God’s temple.
